posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
I smile happily when I see AB +53! ☺
Even your 3rd attack will have warrior AB.
This build is all out weaponmaster.

High AB, high threat range and Dev crit is a deadly combination.

One single tumble dump at lvl 37 can pose a challenge with the AC if you play the levels.
I think the final AC is 30, not 29 if you count the size bonus.
The Achilles-heel of the build is the fort save, especially if you encounter other Dev critters.

The bonus feat at Fighter 10, what do you take there, Improved KD?

Overall a dangerous build, and I like it.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: With no Blind Fight and no Listen or Spot, you'll be vulnerable if someone uses stealth. Other than that, you've assembled quite the killer.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hey Theo!

I would like to suggest a few tweaks to this guy. The last Weapon Master feat leaves nothing but Epic Toughness to choose from and the AB you gain by going Halfling you lose with the STR penalty (which also lowers your Devcrit DC. So, here's what I suggest:

1- Make it Fighter 12 (one extra feat and with this one you can get Epic Weapon Specialization) / WM 25 / Rogue 3: you lose 1 AB from WM 28, but you gain SO MUCH MORE! +1d6 Sneak Attack, Evasion, Uncanny Dodge (mildly useful), a few more skill points and one Epic Bonus Feat with which you can get Epic Fortitude and address what Mick very keenly identified as a weakness of the build.

2- Swap Expertise with Dodge. Expertise is one of the most useful feats early on, and it generally turns any battle in your favor, mathematically speaking.

3- Delay Power Attack and Cleave and take KD and IKD first. Also, no Blind Fight worries me, but all your feats are requirements for WM and Devcrit, so I don't see where to fit it (unless of course you take Blind Fight with the extra feat you'll get with my number 1 suggestion.

Other than that, everything seems to be on point.

Take it EZ!

I don't know, KD / IKD are pretty important. Dealing with Mages or Undead casters such as Belpheron, it's pretty much your only tool. Maybe you can forego IKD for Blind Fight, as mages don't have high Discipline or Strength scores, but I wouldn't drop both. Especially for Toughness. I'm not a fan of the feat. Then you would only KD mages and stealthers. How would you face melee-oriented toons? Are you taking Epic Fortitude and sort of hoping to get the first devcrit?

Take it EZ!
